{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Inventory Manager",
  "description": "GoodLand Xclusive Company is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;Wuye, Abuja (FCT)&nbsp;
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking an organized and proactive Inventory Manager to oversee stock control, supply management, and inventory reporting.
	The Inventory Manager will ensure products and materials are available, properly tracked, and efficiently distributed across departments.


Responsibilities


	Manage and monitor stock levels to prevent shortages and overstocking.
	Maintain accurate inventory records using ERP/software systems.
	Coordinate with procurement and logistics teams for stock replenishment.
	Conduct regular stock audits and reconcile discrepancies.
	Implement inventory control procedures to reduce waste and losses.
	Prepare inventory reports for management decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor&rsquo;s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain, or related field.
	3+ years of proven experience in inventory/stock management.
	Strong knowledge of inventory software and stock control systems.
	Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills.
	Must reside in Abuja.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to:&nbsp;career@goodland.africa&nbsp;using &quot;Inventory Manager&quot; as the subject of the mail.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-16",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",

Inventory Manager Job at GoodLand Xclusive Company




        
    

        
        GoodLand Xclusive Company is recruiting suitably qualified candidates to fill the position below:

Job Position: Inventory Manager

Job Location: Wuye, Abuja (FCT) 
Employment Type: Full-time

Role Overview


	We are seeking an organized and proactive Inventory Manager to oversee stock control, supply management, and inventory reporting.
	The Inventory Manager will ensure products and materials are available, properly tracked, and efficiently distributed across departments.


Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Manage and monitor stock levels to prevent shortages and overstocking.
	Maintain accurate inventory records using ERP/software systems.
	Coordinate with procurement and logistics teams for stock replenishment.
	Conduct regular stock audits and reconcile discrepancies.
	Implement inventory control procedures to reduce waste and losses.
	Prepare inventory reports for management decision-making.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s degree in Business Administration, Supply Chain, or related field.
	3+ years of proven experience in inventory/stock management.
	Strong knowledge of inventory software and stock control systems.
	Excellent organizational and problem-solving skills.
	Must reside in Abuja.


Salary
N100,000 - N150,000 / Month.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: career@goodland.africa using "Inventory Manager" as the subject of the mail.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "J-Six Group is a conglomerate of five subsidiaries in Agro, Cafe, Trade and Logistics, Just Eggs and Quick Service Restaurant; poised towards customers satisfaction, quality products, and friendly discount on purchases.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Supervisor

Job Location:&nbsp;Ijora, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements


	A tertiary Degree is required.
	Minimum of 1 year of work experience as a Team Lead or Supervisor in a fast food chain is a must
	Knowledge of Excel, i-class will be an added advantage.
	Ability to execute tasks through until completion
	Proactivity and the use of initiative are required for this role.
	Must be flexible to take on any shift (morning and afternoon).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;recruitment@jsixgroup.com&nbsp;using the Job Position and location&nbsp;as the subject of the email.
Or
Submit their CV at
J-Six Place,
Gaskiya College Road,
Ijora Rundabout,
Lagos.",

Restaurant Supervisor Job at J-Six Group




        
    

        
        J-Six Group is a conglomerate of five subsidiaries in Agro, Cafe, Trade and Logistics, Just Eggs and Quick Service Restaurant; poised towards customers satisfaction, quality products, and friendly discount on purchases.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Restaurant Supervisor

Job Location: Ijora, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Requirements
     

            
    




	A tertiary Degree is required.
	Minimum of 1 year of work experience as a Team Lead or Supervisor in a fast food chain is a must
	Knowledge of Excel, i-class will be an added advantage.
	Ability to execute tasks through until completion
	Proactivity and the use of initiative are required for this role.
	Must be flexible to take on any shift (morning and afternoon).


Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: recruitment@jsixgroup.com using the Job Position and location as the subject of the email.
Or
Submit their CV at
J-Six Place,
Gaskiya College Road,
Ijora Rundabout,
Lagos.

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Procurement Governance and Compliance Manager",
  "description": "Dangote Group is one of Nigeria&rsquo;s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard &ndash; earned reputation for excellent business practices and products&rsquo; quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position:&nbsp;Procurement Governance and Compliance Manager

Job Location:&nbsp;DIL HQ, Lagos

Description


	A procurement governance and compliance manager ensures an DCP&#39;s procurement activities align with company policies, industry best practices, and legal regulations.
	The scope includes developing and improving procurement policies and processes, managing a governance framework, overseeing risk management, implementing compliance initiatives through training and audits, and reporting on performance to management.


Responsibilities


	Regulatory Monitoring: Stay informed about relevant laws, regulations, and industry best practices to ensure the company&#39;s procurement activities remain compliant.
	Risk Management: Identify, analyze, and mitigate risks associated with procurement activities, implementing strategies to prevent non-compliance.
	Training and Guidance: Provide training, advice, and guidance to procurement teams and other stakeholders on governance policies, procedures, and best practices.
	Performance Monitoring &amp; Reporting: Monitor compliance, track improvement actions, and produce regular reports on governance and performance to support decision-making.
	Process Improvement: Lead projects and initiatives using methodologies like Lean principles to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of procurement processes and systems.
	Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with various internal and external stakeholders, including suppliers and other departments, to ensure effective implementation of governance frameworks and policies.
	Compliance Audits: Conduct assurance activities and audits to verify adherence to established governance and compliance requirements.


Our Ideal Candidate


	Must have a minimum of 5 years of leadership level experience in procurement, compliance, and risk management, with a strong understanding of relevant policies, regulations, and international practices.
	Must have experience developing and implementing policies, managing compliance metrics, conducting audits, and ensuring adherence to legal and organizational standards.
	Leadership: Ability to lead improvement projects and guide teams.
	Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze information, identify risks, and solve problems.
	Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to prepare reports, briefings, and training materials.
	Attention to Detail: A strong focus on accuracy and compliance in all aspects of the role.
	Integrity and Ethics: High ethical standards and a commitment to transparency and accountability.
	Training &amp; Capability Development: Developing and delivering training programs to enhance the knowledge and capability of procurement teams.


Credentials:


	Certified Professional in Strategic Sourcing and Procurement (CPSM)
	Chartered Institute of Procurement &amp; Supply (CIPS) certification.
",
  "datePosted": "2025-09-24",
  "validThrough": "2025-10-25",
  "employmentType": "Full-Time",
  "hiringOrganization": {
    "@type": "Organization",
    "name": "Dangote Group"
    
  },
  "jobLocation": {
    "@type": "Place",
    "address": {
      "@type": "PostalAddress",
       "postalCode": ". ",
       "addressRegion": ". ",
       "streetAddress": ". ",

      "addressCountry": "NG"
     
      
    }
  },
  "identifier": {

    "value": "187826"
  },
  "baseSalary": {
    "@type": "MonetaryAmount",
    "currency": "NGN",
    "value": {
      "@type": "QuantitativeValue",
      "minValue": 0,
      "maxValue": 0,
      "unitText": "MONTH"
    }
  }
}



Procurement Governance and Compliance Manager Job at Dangote Group




        
    

        
        Dangote Group is one of Nigeria’s most diversified business conglomerates with a hard – earned reputation for excellent business practices and products’ quality with its operational headquarters in the bustling metropolis of Lagos, Nigeria in West Africa.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Procurement Governance and Compliance Manager

Job Location: DIL HQ, Lagos

Description
     

            
    




	A procurement governance and compliance manager ensures an DCP's procurement activities align with company policies, industry best practices, and legal regulations.
	The scope includes developing and improving procurement policies and processes, managing a governance framework, overseeing risk management, implementing compliance initiatives through training and audits, and reporting on performance to management.


Responsibilities


	Regulatory Monitoring: Stay informed about relevant laws, regulations, and industry best practices to ensure the company's procurement activities remain compliant.
	Risk Management: Identify, analyze, and mitigate risks associated with procurement activities, implementing strategies to prevent non-compliance.
	Training and Guidance: Provide training, advice, and guidance to procurement teams and other stakeholders on governance policies, procedures, and best practices.
	Performance Monitoring & Reporting: Monitor compliance, track improvement actions, and produce regular reports on governance and performance to support decision-making.
	Process Improvement: Lead projects and initiatives using methodologies like Lean principles to enhance the efficiency and effectiveness of procurement processes and systems.
	Stakeholder Collaboration: Work closely with various internal and external stakeholders, including suppliers and other departments, to ensure effective implementation of governance frameworks and policies.
	Compliance Audits: Conduct assurance activities and audits to verify adherence to established governance and compliance requirements.


Our Ideal Candidate


	Must have a minimum of 5 years of leadership level experience in procurement, compliance, and risk management, with a strong understanding of relevant policies, regulations, and international practices.
	Must have experience developing and implementing policies, managing compliance metrics, conducting audits, and ensuring adherence to legal and organizational standards.
	Leadership: Ability to lead improvement projects and guide teams.
	Analytical Skills: Strong ability to analyze information, identify risks, and solve problems.
	Communication: Excellent written and verbal communication skills to prepare reports, briefings, and training materials.
	Attention to Detail: A strong focus on accuracy and compliance in all aspects of the role.
	Integrity and Ethics: High ethical standards and a commitment to transparency and accountability.
	Training & Capability Development: Developing and delivering training programs to enhance the knowledge and capability of procurement teams.


Credentials:


	Certified Professional in Strategic Sourcing and Procurement (CPSM)
	Chartered Institute of Procurement & Supply (CIPS) certification.
    

    

        Click here to Apply

{
  "@context": "https://schema.org",
  "@type": "JobPosting",
  "title": "Human Resources (HR) Generalist",
  "description": "Youverify is a leading provider of digital identity verification, AML and fraud solutions, dedicated to helping businesses automate and streamline their customer onboarding processes while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. We leverage cutting-edge technologies like artificial intelligence and machine learning to offer accurate and efficient verification solutions that enhance customer trust and operational efficiency. We aim to reduce fraud and support businesses across various industries, including banking, fintech, telecommunications, and e-commerce.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Generalist

Job Location:&nbsp;Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Assist in talent acquisition and recruitment processes.
	Conduct employee onboarding and help organize training &amp; anddevelopment initiatives.
	Provide support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation and resolve any issues that may arise.
	Promote HR programs to create an efficient and conflict-free workplace.
	Assist in development and implementation of human resource policies.
	Undertake tasks around performance management.
	Gather and analyze data with useful HR metrics, like time to hire and employee turnover rates.
	Maintain employee files and records in electronic and paper form.
	Enhance job satisfaction by resolving issues promptly, applying new perks and benefits and organizing team building activities.
	Ensure compliance with labor regulations.


Requirements and Skills


	B.Sc. / B.A in Human Resources, Business Administration or relevant field.
	1 - 2 years of proven experience as an HR Generalist.
	Understanding of general human resources policies, procedures and HR best practices.
	Good knowledge of employment / labor laws.
	Outstanding knowledge of MS Office suite.
	Ability to Compile HR data and metrics from human resource information.
	Excellent communication and people skills.
	Strong decision making and problem-solving skills.
	Professional certification in HR will be a plus (CIPM).


Method of Application&nbsp;
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to:&nbsp;hr@youverify.co&nbsp;using the Job Position as the subject of the email.",

  "validThrough": "2025-10-25",

  },

      "addressCountry": "NG"

Human Resources (HR) Generalist Job at Youverify




        
    

        
        Youverify is a leading provider of digital identity verification, AML and fraud solutions, dedicated to helping businesses automate and streamline their customer onboarding processes while ensuring compliance with regulatory requirements. We leverage cutting-edge technologies like artificial intelligence and machine learning to offer accurate and efficient verification solutions that enhance customer trust and operational efficiency. We aim to reduce fraud and support businesses across various industries, including banking, fintech, telecommunications, and e-commerce.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Human Resources (HR) Generalist
     

            
    



Job Location: Yaba, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Assist in talent acquisition and recruitment processes.
	Conduct employee onboarding and help organize training & anddevelopment initiatives.
	Provide support to employees in various HR-related topics such as leaves and compensation and resolve any issues that may arise.
	Promote HR programs to create an efficient and conflict-free workplace.
	Assist in development and implementation of human resource policies.
	Undertake tasks around performance management.
	Gather and analyze data with useful HR metrics, like time to hire and employee turnover rates.
	Maintain employee files and records in electronic and paper form.
	Enhance job satisfaction by resolving issues promptly, applying new perks and benefits and organizing team building activities.
	Ensure compliance with labor regulations.


Requirements and Skills


	B.Sc. / B.A in Human Resources, Business Administration or relevant field.
	1 - 2 years of proven experience as an HR Generalist.
	Understanding of general human resources policies, procedures and HR best practices.
	Good knowledge of employment / labor laws.
	Outstanding knowledge of MS Office suite.
	Ability to Compile HR data and metrics from human resource information.
	Excellent communication and people skills.
	Strong decision making and problem-solving skills.
	Professional certification in HR will be a plus (CIPM).


Method of Application 
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV to: hr@youverify.co using the Job Position as the subject of the email.    

    

        Click here to Apply

  "description": "Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Officer
Job Location:&nbsp;Lekki, Lagos
Work hour: 12pm - 9pm

Key Responsibilities


	Secondary Contact: Serves as the second point of contact for both drivers and customers.
	Load Management: Handles tracking of drivers and giving timely driver location updates to customers in real time.
	Relationship Building: Foster and maintain positive relationships with customers and drivers.
	Customer Care: Deliver top-notch customer care services consistently.
	Professionalism: Uphold the highest standards of professionalism in all interactions.
	Goal Achievement: Ensure customer satisfaction on every load.


Desired Skills:


	Computer Proficiency
	Very good at customer service and communication.

Customer Service Officer Job at Tribest Corporate Support Limited




        
    

        
        Tribest is a corporate support solutions provider with a comprehensive range of people outsourcing services. We have a diversified team of management, strategy, banking and capacity development experts working together to provide organizations with the best human resource management solutions. With a team that diverse, we are setting new standards of performance and raising the bar in excellent service delivery.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Customer Service Officer
Job Location: Lekki, Lagos
Work hour: 12pm - 9pm

Key Responsibilities
     

            
    




	Secondary Contact: Serves as the second point of contact for both drivers and customers.
	Load Management: Handles tracking of drivers and giving timely driver location updates to customers in real time.
	Relationship Building: Foster and maintain positive relationships with customers and drivers.
	Customer Care: Deliver top-notch customer care services consistently.
	Professionalism: Uphold the highest standards of professionalism in all interactions.
	Goal Achievement: Ensure customer satisfaction on every load.


Desired Skills:


	Computer Proficiency
	Very good at customer service and communication.
    

    

        Click here to Apply
